[h1]Нужен ли был Half life Source в том виде, в которым мы его сейчас имеем?[/h1]
Сразу скажу, в плане сюжета локаций и прочего ничего не поменяли, а HF годнота, надеюсь все это помнят. Но что же у нас с Source? Source это халтура, сделанная второпях, для 2004 года графика отвратительная, проблема не в самих текстурах, а в том, что если посмотреть на 2 текстуры, находящиеся рядом, можно увидеть 1 нормальную, а рядом прямиком из 1999года. И так во всём. Анимации такие же, что и в оригинальном HF, для 1999 хорошо, для 2004 не очень. Игра очень халтурная. 
[b]Рекомендую её брать, либо в Valve pack, либо если вы хотите ещё раз пройти Халфу, но с слегка улучшенной графикой. Остальные, поиграйте лучше в оригинал, он крут.[/b]
UN CAPO EL GORDO HOMBRELIBRE

La recette: Prenez l'original, rajoutez-y des bugs (armes invisibles, collisions, retours windows et j'en passe), sûrement quelques heures au four et pouf: HL "source" (entre guillemets car cette version ne rajoute absolument rien, bien au contraire). Préférez largement l'original ou Black Mesa.

This game is good to have if you need the content from HL1 for the source engine, intend to play Deathmatch or have some interesting mods to play with it. 

As it stands, this product's campaign is full of popular, well-known and well-documented bugs, the likes of which have not been fixed for far too long, and possibly never will. Glaring bugs that aren't avoidable. I ran into not one or two but three glaring issues, all of which I saw in the community posts before I even played it. Initially I thought, 'ouch, those must be rare though'. Nope. A missing texture not loading which left huge blotches of black squares in its' wake, a massive 3D graphical glitch that tears across the entire screen in an important 3D platforming scene, a very memorable Barney moment rendered absurd due to him having no hitbox and infinitely shooting at an iconic boss that's supposed to kill him. There are more than that. 

As of 10/5/2020, I actively not only do not recommend but actively discourage purchase of this title due to these unfixed glitches. I WILL say, to it's benefit, you get better lighting, functional ragdolls, and a few minor gameplay changes throughout the campaign. 

To its' detriment, the bugs are awful, and many subtle aspects simply do not work as they were intended. Small things that die-hard fans would notice, (roaches have no AI for instance, they just run around aimlessly). The SMG weapon is also patently broken, nearly useless beyond 10 feet due to both a dramatically reduced standard accuracy (meaning spread), AND a frankly broken recoil system that automatically rocks the barrel/point of aim up and down far too vigorously as you shoot. Neither small bursts nor semi-automatic shots taken reduce this issue in the least. It is only good at very close ranges. Ranges that the shotgun has always dominated in the first place.

I absolutely, 100% DO recommend purchase of the original Half-Life, Half-Life: Blue Shift, Half-Life: Opposing Force, and Black Mesa. Half-Life, the original, is still THE best experience with it you can have, especially if you grew up with it in the late 90's, early 00's as I did. The two expansions function pretty much flawlessly for me, as does the original. Black Mesa is a lovingly-crafted ode to the original, and so far is amazing in its' own right. Half-Life: Source I would only ever recommend if it was patched. As of now, it's frankly an unconscionable thing to pay that much money for.

As of this time of writing, I cannot recommend this version of the game in its current state.

I was a huge fan of the original Half-Life and thought that a source engine update to the game was a no brainer. What I got instead was a lazy, hackneyed copy riddled with bugs that range from terrible visual artifacts to the inability to progress due to events not triggering (Lambda Core). The only way I was able to even complete the last portion of the game was to noclip through a door and give myself the long jump module, which you wouldn't have had to do with the original version.

This version of the game has been out for a while now and the issues are well documented on various forums and YouTube. It amazes me that the game that put this company on the map would also be given such negligent treatment.

Half-Life: Source itself isn't bad, it's a neat idea and it's great for mods and SFMs.  It's only problems is that it's real buggy, and kinda disappointing as a 'remaster'.

Half-Life, Counter-Strike, and Day of Defeat were all Valve games that ran on Half-Life's 1998 GoldSource engine.  Half-Life 2 later debuted Valve more advanced Source engine in 2004 with updated graphics to match, and Valve had three Source remasters in the works - Half-Life: Source, Counter-Strike: Source, and Day of Defeat: Source.  Counter-Strike: Source and Day of Defeat: Source are pretty much exactly the same as their original GoldSource counterparts, except they have the Source engine's physics and Half-Life 2's style of graphics.  Half-Life: Source is a direct port with Half-Life 1's style of graphics, Source's physics, and buggy as hell.  It's even more disappointing considering Half-Life was/is Valve's flagship game, the series that debuted each of Valve's new engine, Half-Life 2 was new at the time, and the other two Source remasters turned out fine.

If you want to play Half-Life 1 for the first time, I highly recommend playing the original GoldSource version before anything else.  Forget about Half-Life: Source, to hell with the fan-made remake Black Mesa, play the original one first.  If you become a Half-Life fan or you are already a Half-Life fan, play Half-Life: Source later, then maybe try the Black Mesa remake.  It's worth noting that Valve has recently gone back and fixed bugs in their previous games going as far back has the GoldSource engine, so I do have hope that Half-Life: Source will be fixed someday.

Bought this with the Valve Complete Pack several years ago, which also included the original version. This version of the game is bugged and unable to play as intended. After arriving at the facility a security guard was glitched and wouldn't open a door I needed to get through. After restarting the game, the same thing happened.

I gave up and tried on the original version, which had no issues. Buy that one instead.

This (in my opinion) is a very polished game, with only a few problems that i thought were annoying, like the shiny guns, and how the marine in "WE GOT HOSTILES" doesn't shoot the scientist, or how the tentacle monster in "BLAST PIT" doesn't kill the guard. But other than that, playing around with the ragdolls is fun, and the HD models (while still replacing the MP5 and Glock) look a LOT better, along with a lot of the models for things like HECU marines, the flashlight is now an actual flashlight that posts real-time shadows of objects and NPCs instead of being a decal that lights up a small area. Overall, i'd definitely give it a try.

So.
Half Life: Source. A pure pile of S H E T .
Glitches going around like baseball cards. Completely useless but somehow everywhere and nobody that makes them thinks about them.
The chrome texture is GARBAGE, what they should have done is just implemented spheremaps to make a loving port, instead of literally copypasting the assets and making only like half of the stuff that was actually in the finished product ragdolls.
If you want proof of the copypaste, go into asset viewer or Gmod (with hl:s mounted) and look at the assets. Every unused thing kept in the actual, GOOD game was still there. They copypasted, the fockers. The only good things you can do with this shetload of fock is either make a glitch compilation on youtube or use the assets on Gmod to fock around with. Even then, the spheremaps break and you have to download an addon to fix it before realizing the addon clashes with something that shouldn't even be there at all and so it doesn't work with the newest update and just makes every texture supposed to be shiny completely midnight black, so you uninstall it and just deal with the weird black spots that are just there. The chrome textures lead me into the next kinda-organized point,
T H E  L I G H T I N G . This holy focking hellbeast is completely 50/50. Either it looks beautiful, like it should, or it looks like Jimmy The Boy's First Hammer Editing Test, age 11. This persists EVERYWHERE. Another thing I hate is how only, ONLY like 30% of actual in-game assets that SHOULD be ragdolls are ragdolls, the others are just pains in the arse. If you want to pose them with SFM, or pose them in Gmod, well tough titties-- You can't, as not SFM nor Gmod deals with, as Gmod likes to term them, effects. (Effects being non-source-physics effected objects, unposeable and hell-unleashing.
Tl;dr
This focking sucks, buy the goldsrc version instead unless you want to use these for SFM/Gmod.

Basicamente, porque não há motivos pra você comprar essa versão. Half-Life: Source é um port de Half-Life para a Source Engine (utilizada na maioria dos jogos da Valve, como Half-Life 2 e Portal). O jogo tem alguns updates gráficos, mas que não fazem muita diferença, sem contar a quantidade de bugs. Se você quer jogar Half-Life, eu recomendo comprar a versão original que roda na GoldSrc (GoldSource). Se você quer jogar Half-Life na Source Engine ou uma versão melhor / atualizada de Half-Life, compre Black Mesa.
Only good if you want to play a game that's basically a Glitch Sundae with a topping of bugs, or if you want more Garry's Mod content

This is a lazy port of the original game. The only changes are added ragdolls instead of death animations. And the water looks HD but it meshes terribly with the game's old graphics.

It also has a load of bugs and glitches. A lot of features are absent as well, lots of quality of life details are removed from this version that made the original feel more of a living and breathing world.

Either play the original or the Black Mesa remake. Only get this for a collection, otherwise don't bother.

If you plan on playing Half-Life, I'd highly recommend the original game. This version is littered with glitches that occasionally break the game and the controls are completely broken. This is due to the game being ported to the source engine. It is very unlikely that Valve will fix these. Upon booting up the original these problems disappeared and I found the experience very agreeable.
